question: In order to avoid being hit in the rear by another vehicle, you should do which of the following?
choices: Drive cautiously and use your brakes often.
explanation: Even properly adjusted mirrors cannot eliminate blind spots; drivers must check over their shoulder before changing lanes.

question: A car that pitches and tosses in normal driving and leans heavily to the side in turns is likely to have trouble in which of the following systems?
explanation: The suspension system controls body movement and stability. When it fails, worn shock absorbers cause pitching/tossing during driving and excessive body roll when turning.

question: What happens if a driver refuses to take a chemical test?
choices: He/She gets an immediate 30 day revocation.
The DMV adds an extra 12 months revocation.
explanation: Refusing a chemical test results in immediate 30-day revocation AND an additional minimum 12-month DMV revocation. Both penalties apply.

question: A person has been convicted of DWI for the 4th time in 7 years.
choices: This person may be imprisoned from 1 to 3 years.
This person can only get a restricted license.
explanation: A 4th DWI conviction (with prior convictions within 7 years) results in felony charges with 1-3 years imprisonment and permanent license revocation—not a restricted license.

question: Which of the following statements about horns and sirens is/are correct?
choices: Every licensed motor vehicle must have a horn.
Only law enforcement and emergency vehicles may have sirens.
explanation: Every motor vehicle must have a working horn audible from 200 feet, and only law enforcement/emergency vehicles may have sirens.

question: A 20 year old driver is convicted of driving after drinking alcohol.
explanation: Drivers under 21 convicted of driving with any alcohol in their system face mandatory one-year license revocation. No mandatory 14-day imprisonment is specified.

question: Every motor vehicle must be equipped with:
explanation: Every motor vehicle must have a muffler or exhaust system in good working order to prevent excessive noise and smoke.

question: Which of the following statements is false?
choices: A heavier person has to ingest more alcohol than a lighter person to reach the same blood alcohol content.
A heavier person can eliminate alcohol faster than a lighter person.
If two persons drink at the same speed, the heavier person will need longer to reach the same blood alcohol concentration.
A heavier person needs to drink more than a lighter person because alcohol mixes with the body fluids. Obviously, a heavier person has more body fluids than a lighter person.
explanation: Alcohol elimination occurs at a constant rate (about 0.015% BAC per hour) regardless of body weight. The liver processes alcohol at the same rate for everyone. Time is the only thing that sobers up a drinker.

question: A driver may be temporarily blinded at night by which of the following?
choices: Glare from the headlights of other cars.
Flame from a match he strikes to light a cigarette.
explanation: A driver can be blinded by the headlights of oncoming vehicles

question: If you should have a blowout while traveling at a high speed, you should do which of the following?
choices: Brake firmly as soon as you notice the blowout.
Grip the steering wheel firmly to keep the car from swerving.
explanation: Hold the steering wheel tightly and try to keep the vehicle straight. Do not apply the brakes until the engine has slowed the vehicle enough to maintain control.

question: When rounding a curve, a car tends to:
choices: Move to the inside of the curve.
Stay in the center of the lane.
Move to the outside of the curve.
explanation: Due to centrifugal force, vehicles naturally tend toward the outside of curves. The handbook instructs drivers to 'stay on your side of the road and drive as far to the right as you can' when rounding curves to counteract this tendency.

question: When does the law give a blind pedestrian special consideration at intersections where there are no traffic lights?
choices: If he holds out a white cane or has a guide dog with him.
explanation: The law gives a blind pedestrian special consideration at an intersection where there are no traffic signals when the pedestrian extends a white cane, or white cane with red tip or has guide dog.

question: You are driving on an interstate highway when a breakdown forces you to the shoulder. You should:
choices: Sit in the car until help arrives.
Tie a handkerchief to the left door handle and stand beside the left front fender.
Raise the hood and tie a white handkerchief to the left door handle.
Raise the hood and stand behind the car so drivers of oncoming cars can see you.
explanation: Make sure you leave the vehicle by the passenger side, and do not allow passengers to remain in the vehicle. Stand off the road and away from the vehicle. If you need help, tie a white cloth to left door handle or radio aerial and raise the hood.

question: Four vehicles approach an intersection with a 4 way stop at the same time. Car B is ahead of Car A and both are in the same lane and want to proceed straight across. Car C is across the intersection from Car B and wants to proceed straight as well. Car D is to the right of Car B and wants to make a right turn. Which car must yield?
explanation: At intersections, the vehicle already in the intersection has the right of way ahead of any vehicle that has not yet entered. Since Car B is ahead of Car A in the same lane, Car A must yield to Car B before entering the intersection.

question: When backing your car, you should do which of the following?
choices: Move at no more than 10 mph.
Keep both hands on the steering wheel.
explanation: Back very slowly, not more than 10 mph — your vehicle is harder to control and stop when backing.

question: Accidents occur most frequently at which of the following?
explanation: Crashes occur most frequently at intersections, and they are considered the most dangerous places on a street or highway. More than one-third of fatal traffic crashes involving motor vehicles occur at intersections.

question: The percentage of highway deaths caused by drunken persons is about:
explanation: About 38 percent of all traffic fatalities involve alcohol.

question: Which of the following statements about bicycle riders is correct?
choices: They must ride their bicycles facing traffic.
They are likely to be seriously injured in almost any collision with a car.
explanation: Ride right, with the traffic, NOT facing traffic. Bicyclists must ride WITH traffic flow, not against it. Statement B is correct given bicycles' vulnerability in collisions with vehicles.

question: Highway accidents occur most frequently:
explanation: Crashes occur most frequently at intersections, and they are considered the most dangerous places on a street or highway. More than one-third of fatal traffic crashes involving motor vehicles occur at intersections.

question: When driving on a highway at night, you should never use your high-beam headlights if you are:
choices: Traveling on a road with no median.
explanation: Use high-beam headlights unless you are approaching or following another vehicle and dim them when within 500ft of an oncoming vehicle or when 200ft or less behind a vehicle travelling in your direction.

question: A diamond-shaped traffic sign means:
choices: Slow down and drive with care.
explanation: Diamond-shaped signs are caution or warning signs. When you see one of these signs, drive with extra care. These are warning signs requiring increased caution, not stop/yield/no-turn signs.

question: Which of the following statement(s) about speed limits for cars in North Carolina is correct?
choices: The speed limit outside a city is 55mph unless otherwise posted.
The speed limit inside a city is 25 mph unless otherwise posted.
explanation: Outside cities and towns: 55. Unless otherwise posted, the speed limit is 35 mph in cities and towns.

question: When driving on a long trip, you should:
choices: Rest your eyes from time to time by rubbing them.
Avoid looking at any one thing for more than a few seconds.
Keep your eyes on the center of the road straight ahead.
Spend as much time looking in your mirrors as you do looking in front of you.
explanation: Good drivers try to see 10 to 15 seconds ahead on the roadway.

question: Is it true that coffee can neutralize the effects of alcohol?
choices: No, only the liver can eliminate alcohol.
Yes, if you drink it black and without sugar.
Yes, if you can take a cold shower.
explanation: The only thing that sobers up a drinker is time. Coffee, a big meal or cold showers will not work.

question: If you come to an unmarked intersection where it is hard to see in all directions because of trees or buildings, you should:
choices: Drive at the posted speed limit.
Stop near the center of the intersection and continue if it is safe.
Slow down and sound your horn to warn drivers who cannot see you.
Stop at the intersection and move forward slowly.
explanation: At unmarked intersections where it is hard to see in all directions, stop and then move forward slowly and cautiously.

question: When changing a flat tire, you should do which of the following?
choices: Put the vehicle in neutral gear.
explanation: The NC Driver Handbook instructs drivers to block the wheels when changing a tire to prevent the vehicle from rolling. The vehicle should not be placed in neutral.

question: The maximum speed limit for a full size public school bus in North Carolina is:
explanation: North Carolina law sets the maximum speed limit for a full-size school bus at 55 mph.

question: Which of the following statements about pedestrian deaths is correct?
choices: In cities, 2 out of 5 people killed in motor vehicle accidents are pedestrians.
Most of the pedestrians killed in all traffic accidents are teenagers.
explanation: The NC Driver Handbook does not support either statement. Pedestrian fatalities are not predominantly teenagers, and the city statistic given is incorrect.

question: Wet brakes can be dried out by doing which of the following?
choices: Slow down and then press the gas pedal as you keep a light pressure on the brake pedal.
explanation: The handbook advises lightly applying the brakes while driving slowly to generate heat and dry wet brakes.

question: When driving in heavy traffic, you should do which of the following?
choices: Watch out for drivers who make quick stops.
Yield to pedestrians only at marked crosswalks
explanation: Drivers should always watch for sudden stops in heavy traffic. Pedestrians must be yielded to whether or not a crosswalk is marked.

question: When pulling a trailer down a long steep hill, you should do which of the following?
explanation: Using a lower gear helps control speed, and staying in the right lane allows faster traffic to pass safely.

question: If your car breaks down on the highway at night, what should you do?
choices: Park the car completely off the road.
explanation: The handbook advises parking completely off the roadway and using hazard lights, not high beams.

question: Roads are likely to be especially slick:
choices: Just after they have been paved.
Just after it has begun to rain or drizzle.
After it has been raining for several hours.
explanation: Oil and dust rise to the surface when rain first begins, making roads especially slippery.

question: If you miss your exit on an interstate highway, you can do which of the following?
choices: Go on to the next exit.
explanation: U-turns are illegal on interstates. Drivers must proceed to the next exit.

question: As you approach an intersection to make a right turn, you should turn on your right turn signal and do which of the following?
choices: Steer slightly toward the center of the road to give yourself room to clear the corner.
Hold your arm straight out the window.
explanation: Drivers should stay close to the right curb when turning right, and a straight arm signals a left turn, not a right turn.

question: A leaky exhaust system should be repaired because it:
choices: Causes the engine to run hot.
May allow dangerous fumes to enter the car.
Makes the engine hard to start and likely to stall.
explanation: A leaking exhaust can allow carbon monoxide and other toxic fumes to enter the passenger compartment.

question: Passing on the right is legal on which of the following?
choices: A 4-lane highway with 2-lanes going in each direction.
explanation: Passing on the right is legal on multi-lane roads and on one-way streets when conditions permit.

question: What should you do when you begin to skid?
choices: Turn the steering while in the direction in which the rear end of the car is skidding.
Reduce pressure on the gas pedal.
explanation: The handbook advises easing off the gas and steering in the direction of the skid to regain control.

question: Conviction for which of the following carries the highest number of points?
choices: Hit and run with property damage.
Passing a stopped school bus unloading children.
explanation: Passing a stopped school bus carries the highest point penalty due to the extreme danger involved.

question: When you are walking at night along a road without sidewalks, you should do which of the following?
choices: Walk on the left, facing traffic.
Keep your back to oncoming traffic.
explanation: Pedestrians should walk facing traffic so they can see approaching vehicles.

question: The best way to get good traction on hard packed snow is to:
choices: Have lower than usual air pressure in your tires.
Carry heavy weights in your trunk.
explanation: Snow tires are designed to provide maximum traction on packed snow and icy surfaces.

question: To reduce speed while going down a steep hill, you should do which of the following?
explanation: Using a lower gear helps control speed without overheating the brakes.

question: If your brakes fail, you should do which of the following?
explanation: The handbook advises shifting to a lower gear and carefully applying the emergency brake.

question: Studies have shown which of the following to be a serious traffic hazard?
explanation: Driving significantly slower than surrounding traffic disrupts flow and increases crash risk.

question: What is the effect of food when you drink alcohol?
choices: If you eat before drinking, alcohol enters the blood stream at a slower pace.
It neutralizes the effects of alcohol.
explanation: Eating before drinking slows the absorption of alcohol into the bloodstream.

question: When a driver has a total of 7 points, which of the following may happen?
choices: The driver can be required to file proof of financial responsibility.
The driver can have 3 points deducted if he/she satisfactorily completes a Driver Improvement Clinic.
explanation: At 7 points, both consequences are possible under North Carolina law.

question: In North Carolina, which of the following is required on all cars?
explanation: All vehicles must have a light to illuminate the rear license plate.

question: If you wish to pass the car ahead on a two-lane road, you should do which of the following?
choices: Sound your horn to signal your intention to the driver of the car ahead.
Give a left turn signal to let the driver behind you know your intention.
explanation: A left turn signal alerts drivers behind you. Sounding the horn is not recommended.

question: What happens if a driver is convicted of DWI while his/her license has already been revoked for a prior DWI?
choices: This person's car may be seized and sold.
explanation: North Carolina law allows for both vehicle seizure and imprisonment in this situation.

question: When driving on a city street, you should watch out for which of the following?
choices: Animals or small children darting from between parked cars.
explanation: Both hazards are common in city driving environments.

question: A person has been drinking but did not reach 0.08. Can we assume that he/she can drive safely?
choices: Yes, if the driver ate before drinking.
Yes, if the driver is a heavy person.
No, because even smaller amounts can affect judgment.
Yes, if the driver is not too tired.
explanation: Even small amounts of alcohol can impair judgment and reaction time.

question: Studies have shown that under normal conditions the chance of a car being involved in an accident on an interstate highway is greater if the driver:
choices: Travels considerably below the posted speed limit.
Travels at the posted speed limit.
Maintains his position relative to cars in front and behind him in his lane.
explanation: Driving much slower than traffic flow increases collision risk.

question: A driver who is involved in an accident should do which of the following?
choices: Make an immediate report to the nearest law enforcement agency.
explanation: Both actions are required or recommended after an accident.

question: Three vehicles approach an uncontrolled intersection. Car A is on the right of Car B. Car C is on the left of Car B. In which order should the cars pass through the intersection?
choices: Car A, Car B, Car C.
Car B, Car A. Car C.
Car C, Car A, Car B.
Car B, Car C, Car A.
explanation: At uncontrolled intersections, drivers yield to the vehicle on their right.

question: A driver license is required for the following?
choices: Sitting in the driver's seat of a car while the engine is running.
Steering a car while it is being pushed or towed by another vehicle.
explanation: Both situations involve control of a vehicle and require a valid driver license.

question: Roughly half of all traffic fatalities involve which of the following?
explanation: Approximately half of all traffic fatalities involve alcohol impairment.

question: When driving in a heavy snowstorm during the day, you should use:
explanation: The NC Driver Handbook advises using low-beam headlights in snow to improve visibility without causing glare.

question: A flashing red traffic signal at an intersection means which of the following?
choices: Slow down and proceed with caution.
Stop, only if it is necessary to yield the right-of-way.
explanation: A flashing red signal has the same meaning as a stop sign: drivers must stop and then proceed when it is safe.

question: What is one of the effects of alcohol on the driver's eyes?
choices: They eyes tend to stare at a point.
The eyes notice better motions on the sides.
The eyes catch very early other drivers' mistakes.
explanation: Alcohol reduces eye movement and peripheral vision, causing drivers to stare straight ahead.

question: If it starts to drizzle while you are driving, you should do which of the following?
choices: Slow down because the rain will loosen oil and gravel on the road.
Allow at least twice the normal following distance.
explanation: Light rain loosens oil on the road, increasing skid risk, and requires greater following distance.

question: Two vehicles approach an intersection going in opposite directions with no signs or traffic lights. There is also a pedestrian waiting to cross the street and is walking in the same direction as Car 1. Car 1 wants to proceed straight through the intersection. Car 2 wants to make a left turn. In this situation, the right-of-away belongs to:
choices: Driver of Car 1 and the pedestrian.
explanation: Drivers going straight and pedestrians in the crosswalk have the right-of-way over vehicles making left turns.

question: When can you disregard a signal given by a police officer directing traffic?
choices: The officer's signal is in conflict with a traffic signal.
explanation: You must always obey a police officer directing traffic, even if signals or situations appear conflicting.

question: Can you be prosecuted in a criminal court of law if you are intercepted as you are driving under the influence of a prescribed medication?
choices: Not if you bring the prescription with you.
Yes, the law requires you to be in full control of yourself when you drive.
No, if something happens the doctor will be prosecuted.
No, as long as you do not reach 0.08.
explanation: Drivers are responsible for operating a vehicle safely regardless of whether impairment comes from alcohol or prescription medication.

question: What is the main color for signs in highway work zones?
explanation: Orange signs are used in work zones to warn drivers of construction and maintenance hazards.

question: If you begin to feel sleepy while driving on a long trip, you should do which of the following?
choices: Open a window or vent to let in fresh air.
explanation: Fresh air can help temporarily, but increasing speed is unsafe and not recommended.

question: When driving through heavy fog, you should:
choices: Follow the car in front you closely.
explanation: Reducing speed is essential in fog. Bright lights cause glare and reduce visibility.

question: If you are in the wrong lane for making a left turn at an intersection, you should:
choices: Go to the next intersection and turn there.
Back up and move into the correct lane for turning.
Wait until all other cars have cleared the intersection and turn.
Signal the driver in the car beside you that you intend to turn in front of him.
explanation: Backing up or forcing a turn is unsafe. Drivers should proceed to the next intersection.

question: A driver was convicted of a second DWI 3 years ago. He/She gets convicted of DWI again.
choices: He/She is imprisoned from 14 days to 24 months.
explanation: A third DWI conviction within seven years can result in permanent license revocation and imprisonment.

question: A safe driver does which of the following?
choices: Watches the side of the road over the hood to stay in line.
Frequently checks the rear-view and side mirrors.
Drinks coffee while driving at night to stay alert.
Keeps 2 car lengths between his/her car and the next car on the expressway.
explanation: Frequent mirror checks help drivers remain aware of surrounding traffic conditions.

question: A driver will lose his/her license if he/she is convicted of:
choices: Speeding more than 75 mph in a 55mph zone.
explanation: Passing a stopped school bus carries mandatory license suspension under North Carolina law.

question: If you have to come to a stop on an icy road and your car is not equipped with ABS brakes, you should:
choices: Apply the brake in short hard jabs.
explanation: Pumping the brakes helps prevent wheel lock-up on icy roads without ABS.

question: Very slow driving is especially dangerous in which of the following situations?
choices: Just after passing the crest of a hill.
explanation: Drivers coming over hills or around curves may not expect very slow traffic, increasing collision risk.

question: What happens if you drink alcohol and take medication at the same time?
choices: Medication always cancels the effects of alcohol.
Alcohol always cancels the effects of medication.
Both may combine and have unpredictable effects.
There is no scientific evidence that it changes anything.
explanation: Alcohol and medication can interact unpredictably and significantly impair driving ability.

question: What should you do if a doctor prescribes you some medication but you must drive?
choices: Ask the doctor whether you can drive or not.
Check your reactions as you drive and be ready to stop if you feel affected.
Bring an antidote to cancel the effects of the drug.
Do not worry; prescribed drugs never affect driving.
explanation: Drivers should consult their doctor about possible driving impairment before operating a vehicle.

question: When taking a long trip on an interstate highway, you should plan on doing which of the following?
choices: Stopping every 100 miles at a rest area.
Scheduling some hours of night driving to avoid heavy traffic.
explanation: Regular rest stops help prevent fatigue; night driving is not recommended.

question: A diamond-shaped sign would be used to warn drivers of which of the following driving hazards?
explanation: Diamond-shaped signs are warning signs, such as those used for animal crossings.

question: In which of the following situations should you use your low beams?
explanation: Low beams reduce glare in cities and improve visibility in fog or mist.

question: If your car breaks down on a highway at night, you should do which of the following?
choices: Raise the hood and tie a white handkerchief to the left door handle.
explanation: Both actions help alert other drivers that your vehicle is disabled.

question: If you approach an intersection where there are no traffic lights/signs and a pedestrian is attempting to cross your path, who has the right-of-way?
explanation: Pedestrians always have the right-of-way at intersections, marked or unmarked, when crossing legally.

question: A flashing yellow traffic signal at an intersection means:
choices: Slow down and proceed with caution.
explanation: A flashing yellow signal warns drivers to slow down and proceed carefully.

question: If a law enforcement officer swears that a driver has refused a legal chemical test, the Division of Motor Vehicles must:
choices: Wait for a court decision before taking action.
Assign the driver to the Driver Improvement Clinic.
Revoke the driver's license for at least 12 months.
explanation: Refusal of a lawful chemical test results in an automatic 12-month license revocation in North Carolina.

question: When rounding a sharp curve, you should do which of the following?
choices: Stay as far to the left of your lane as possible.
Brake in the sharpest part of the curve.
explanation: Drivers should slow before entering the curve and stay centered in their lane, not brake sharply mid-curve.

question: Which of the following happen(s) under the point system?
choices: A driver is sent a warning letter when he/she gets 4 points within 3 years.
A driver who gets 12 points within 3 years may lose his/her license.
explanation: North Carolina sends warning letters at 4 points and may suspend licenses at 12 points within three years.

question: Which traffic is required to stop if a school bus makes a passenger stop in the far right lane on a five-lane street?
choices: Lanes going in the same direction as the school bus.
Lanes going in the opposite direction of the bus.
explanation: Only traffic traveling in the same direction as the bus must stop when there is a center turning lane.

question: If your vehicle has run off the road onto the shoulder, you should:
choices: Shift quickly into a lower gear.
Take your foot off the gas pedal gradually.
explanation: Gradually easing off the accelerator helps maintain control and prevents skidding.

question: The system that carries harmful fumes from the engine to the rear of the car and releases them is called the:
explanation: The exhaust system routes engine fumes safely away from the passenger compartment.

question: Which of the following statements about speed limits in North Carolina is correct?
choices: Unless otherwise posted, the speed limit inside a city is 35 mph.
Unless otherwise posted, the speed limit for a school activity bus is 25 mph.
explanation: Both statements reflect standard North Carolina speed limits unless otherwise posted.

question: Which statement(s) concerning speed limits on the open road in North Carolina is correct?
choices: Unless otherwise posted, the speed limit for passenger cars and pickup trucks is 65 mph.
The speed limit for a school activity bus is 35 mph.
explanation: North Carolina allows 65 mph on open highways and limits school activity buses to 35 mph.

question: Where does alcohol tend to concentrate more?
explanation: Alcohol concentrates in the brain, impairing judgment, vision, and coordination.

question: Which one contains more alcohol?
choices: They all have the same amount; .6 of an ounce (18ml) of alcohol.
explanation: Each of these drinks contains approximately the same amount of pure alcohol.

question: The most frequent type of accident on an interstate highways is:
explanation: Rear-end collisions are the most common accidents on interstate highways due to speed and traffic flow.

question: If you are walking along a road at night, what should you do?
choices: Walk on the right-hand side with the traffic.
explanation: Wearing or carrying white or reflective material makes pedestrians more visible at night.

question: Your brakes need checking if:
choices: There is a strong smell of gasoline in the car.
The engine stalls at stop lights.
Light gusts of wind make the car difficult to control.
There is a squeaking noise when you step on the brake pedal.
explanation: Unusual noises when braking often indicate worn or malfunctioning brake components.

question: If a law enforcement officer swears that a driver has refused a legal chemical test, the Division of Motor Vehicles must:
choices: Wait for a court decision before taking action.
Assign the driver to the Driver Improvement Clinic.
Revoke the driver's license for at least 12 months.
explanation: North Carolina law mandates license revocation for refusing a lawful chemical test.

question: Skids are likely to occur on which of the following roads?
choices: One on which snow has become packed
One that has just been paved.
explanation: Both packed snow and newly paved roads can be slick and cause skidding.

question: To get a revoked driver license restored, a person must do which of the following?
choices: Obtain permission from the Driver License Section in Raleigh to reapply for a license.
Go to a driver license office, pay a restoration fee, and reapply for a license.
explanation: Both approval and reapplication with applicable fees are required for license restoration.

question: If the driver of an approaching car fails to dim his/her lights, you should do which of the following?
choices: Watch the road ahead to avoid looking at the lights of the other car.
Flick your headlight beams high and low once or twice.
explanation: Drivers should avoid staring into bright lights and may flash headlights briefly as a signal.

question: Three vehicles approach an uncontrolled intersection. Car A wants to make a left turn and is across the intersection from Car B. Car B is ahead of Car C and both are in the same lane traveling in the same direction and want to proceed straight through the intersection. The law gives the right-of-way:
choices: To Car A and Then Car B.
To Car B and then Car A.
explanation: Vehicles going straight have the right-of-way over vehicles making left turns at uncontrolled intersections.

question: When trying to pull away from a slippery surface in a car with a manual transmission, you should do which of the following:
choices: Start in second or high gear.
explanation: Starting in a higher gear reduces wheel spin and improves traction on slippery surfaces.

question: When approaching a stopped emergency vehicle displaying flashing lights on a multi-lane highway, a driver must:
choices: Slow down and move into the lane farthest from the vehicle if possible.
Stop completely until the emergency vehicle moves.
Sound the horn to alert the emergency worker.
explanation: North Carolina law requires drivers to slow down and move over when approaching emergency vehicles with flashing lights.

question: A solid yellow line on your side of the center line means:
choices: Passing is allowed at any time.
Passing is allowed only during daylight hours.
Passing is allowed only for motorcycles.
explanation: A solid yellow line indicates that passing is not permitted because it may be unsafe.

question: What should you do if your accelerator pedal sticks while driving?
choices: Shift to neutral and apply steady braking.
explanation: Shifting into neutral and braking steadily allows the vehicle to slow safely without engine power.

question: When driving in fog, rain, or snow, you should use:
explanation: Low-beam headlights reduce glare and improve visibility in fog and other poor weather conditions.

question: At what blood alcohol concentration (BAC) is a driver age 21 or older considered legally impaired in North Carolina?
explanation: A BAC of 0.08% or higher is illegal for drivers age 21 and over in North Carolina.

question: When two vehicles arrive at a four-way stop intersection at the same time, who has the right-of-way?
explanation: When vehicles arrive simultaneously, the driver on the left must yield to the driver on the right.

question: If your vehicle begins to skid, the first thing you should do is:
choices: Take your foot off the accelerator.
explanation: Releasing the accelerator helps regain traction and control during a skid.

question: A broken yellow line on your side of the road means:
choices: You must yield to oncoming traffic.
explanation: A broken yellow line indicates passing is permitted when the way is clear.

question: What does a steady red arrow signal mean?
choices: No turn is allowed in the direction of the arrow.
explanation: A steady red arrow means turning in the direction of the arrow is prohibited.

question: When parking downhill with a curb, you should turn your front wheels:
explanation: Turning wheels away from the curb prevents the vehicle from rolling into traffic if it moves.

question: What is the safest action when an emergency vehicle approaches with lights and siren on?
choices: Speed up to get out of the way
Move to the right and stop
Stop in the middle of your lane
explanation: North Carolina law requires drivers to pull over to the right and stop until the emergency vehicle passes.

question: What is the main reason to keep a safe following distance?
choices: It allows more time to react to hazards
It discourages other drivers from passing
It helps your tires warm up
explanation: A safe following distance increases reaction time and reduces rear-end collisions.

question: If your tires begin to lose traction during rain, what should you do first?
choices: Press the accelerator to regain control
Brake hard to slow down quickly
Ease off the gas and steer straight
Turn sharply to correct your direction
explanation: Hydroplaning is corrected by easing off the accelerator and keeping the wheel straight until traction returns.

question: When is it legal to use your horn?
choices: To greet a friend as you pass their house
To warn others of a safety hazard
To express frustration at another driver
explanation: The horn is a safety device used to warn others of danger, not for non-emergency communication.

question: What is the safest way to enter a curve?
choices: Maintain the same speed you approached with
Slow down before entering, then gently accelerate
Speed up to reduce the chance of skidding
explanation: Slowing before the curve provides stability, while gentle acceleration helps maintain traction through the turn.

question: What should you do if the vehicle ahead of you is driving unpredictably?
choices: Move closer to observe their behavior
Back off and increase your following distance
Honk repeatedly to get their attention
explanation: Increasing distance gives you more time to avoid sudden movements from unsafe drivers.

question: When driving at night, when should you use your high-beam headlights?
choices: Whenever you want to see road signs more clearly
On open roads with no oncoming traffic
When you are tired and need to stay awake
explanation: High beams should only be used when no other drivers will be blinded by the glare.

question: What is a key sign that you may be drowsy while driving?
choices: You are adjusting the radio frequently
You cannot remember the last few miles driven
You glance in your mirrors often
Your hands feel tight on the wheel
explanation: Memory lapses are a major warning sign of fatigue and reduced alertness.

question: What is the safest action if your vehicle begins to skid?
choices: Steer in the direction you want the front of the car to go
Turn away from the direction of the skid
explanation: Steering gently in the direction you want to go aligns the vehicle and helps regain control.

question: What should you do when approaching a school bus with its red lights flashing?
choices: Stop, regardless of your direction of travel
Continue if no children are visible
Honk twice to alert the driver
explanation: In North Carolina, all traffic must stop for a bus with active red signals unless on a divided highway with a physical median.

question: When merging onto an interstate, what is the recommended procedure?
choices: Stop at the end of the ramp and wait for a gap
Match the speed of traffic on the highway
Merge at a much lower speed to avoid conflict
explanation: Matching speed allows for smoother merging and reduces the chance of collisions.

question: What is the safest way to handle a yellow traffic light?
choices: Speed up to beat the red light
Stop if you can do so safely
explanation: A yellow light warns that the light is changing; stopping safely is the proper response.

question: If you experience a tire blowout, what is your first action?
choices: Grip the wheel firmly and slow down gradually
explanation: Sudden braking can cause loss of control; gradual slowing helps stabilize the vehicle.

question: What should you do if you miss your highway exit?
choices: Make a U-turn in the median
Cut across the shoulder to exit
explanation: Stopping or reversing on a highway is extremely dangerous; continue to the next exit safely.

question: Why is it important to signal well before turning?
choices: It allows other drivers time to react
It reduces wear on your vehicle's brakes
It helps maintain good fuel economy
It keeps the ignition system cool
explanation: Signaling early improves safety by giving others adequate warning.

question: How should you adjust your driving in heavy fog?
choices: Use high beams for maximum visibility
Slow down and use low-beam headlights
explanation: Low beams reduce glare in fog and improve visibility; high beams worsen it.

question: What does a diamond-shaped traffic sign indicate?
explanation: Diamond signs universally indicate warnings about road conditions or hazards.

question: Why should you increase following distance at night?
choices: Depth perception decreases in the dark
explanation: Reduced visibility and depth perception require extra space to react safely.

question: What should you do when driving through a work zone?
choices: Maintain normal speed unless workers are present
Slow down and be prepared for sudden stops
explanation: Work zones often have unpredictable traffic patterns and require slower speeds.

question: If your brakes fail while driving, what is your safest first step?
choices: Steer into oncoming traffic to stop

question: When are roads most slippery during a rainstorm?
choices: During the first few minutes of rainfall
explanation: The first rain loosens oils on the road surface, creating unusually slick conditions.

question: When must drivers yield to pedestrians?
choices: At all crosswalks, marked or unmarked
Only at intersections with traffic signals
explanation: Pedestrians have right-of-way at all crosswalks, whether painted or unmarked.

question: What should you do before changing lanes on a multi-lane road?

Signal, check mirrors, and look over your shoulder
Drift slowly between lanes until clear
explanation: Proper lane changes require signaling and checking all blind spots before moving.

question: When driving on icy roads, what is the best way to stop safely?
choices: Pump the brakes gently if you do not have ABS
explanation: Without ABS, pumping prevents wheel lock. ABS-equipped vehicles should brake steadily.
